noun.description: A small Spanish silver coin formerly in circulation chiefly in central and southern N. America and the Caribbean. Now historical.

adjective.description: Petty, paltry; of little value. Compare "picayune". Now rare and literary.

origin: Mid 18th century; earliest use found in The Pennsylvania Gazette. Apparently alteration of Spanish peseta peseta + -een, after nouns ending in -reen.
